smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the file contain visible elements.
In the Use Case diagram (Page 2), all use cases (ovals) are associated with at least one actor (lines connect them either directly or via the 'Tuvasta kasutaja' use case).
No duplicate use case names describing the same activity were found.
No distinct model elements with the same name were found within the same package.
No obvious redundant data columns without Foreign Key connections were found in the database diagrams.
All use cases on Page 2 start with a verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Lõpeta', 'Registreeri').
In the state diagram (Page 11), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, etc.) are reachable from the initial state 'Alg'.
All actions in the activity diagrams (Pages 3 and 4) appear to be reachable via the decision flows.

Relationships in class and database diagrams generally have multiplicity indicators (e.g., '1', '0..*'). Relationships lacking them are generalizations or dependencies where strict multiplicity is not required.
The Use Case diagram on Page 2 contains 11 use cases (visual oval elements), which exceeds the threshold of 10.

On Page 10 (Parkimiskoha register), the class 'Parkimiskoht' has 6 visual connection lines to other classes (Parkimiskoha_kategooria_omamine, Parkimiskoha_suurus, Parkimiskoha_aadress, Parkimiskoha_seisundi_liik, and two connections to Töötaja/Isik).
The layout of the diagrams is relatively compact and no related elements were found to be excessively distant.

On Page 4, the activity diagram action 'Parkimiskoha haldur valib parkimiskoha' starts with a noun ('Parkimiskoha') instead of an active verb (e.g., 'Vali parkimiskoht'). Similarly, 'Parkimiskoha aktiveerimine õnnestub' starts with a noun.
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found with 3 or fewer characters (excluding accepted abbreviations or stereotypes).
Class names consistently start with uppercase letters and are singular.
Attribute names consistently start with lowercase letters.
Table names in the database diagrams are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Tootaja').
No inappropriate Hungarian notation prefixes (like tbl_, str_) were found on element names.
